文献ID: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_015_chunk2
证据片段: Specimens, $1 . 5 \mathrm { c m }$ long and $1 4 \mathrm { c m } ^ { 2 }$ in area, were cut from standard Zircaloy-4 fuel cladding (cold-worked and stress-relieved tube $1 . 5 \ \mathrm { c m }$ in diameter and $0 . 0 4 ~ { \mathfrak { c m } }$ in wall thickness)

文献ID: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_015_chunk2
证据片段: The $Z \mathrm { r } { - } 2 . 5 ~ \mathrm { w t } \%$ Nb specimens, $2 \mathsf { c m }$ by $1 \mathrm { c m }$ and $6 { \mathrm { c m } } ^ { 2 }$ in area, were machined from Canadian Deuterium Uranium (CANDU) pressure tube material (cold-worked and stress-relieved at $\bf { 6 7 3 ~ K }$ for $^ { 2 0 \mathrm { ~ h ~ } }$ $1 0 ~ \mathsf { c m }$ diameter tube with $0 . 4 ~ \mathrm { c m }$ wall thickness)

文献ID: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_015_chunk2
证据片段: All the corrosion testings were carried out at $5 8 9 \mathrm { K }$ in $1 { - } \mathbf { L }$ stainless steel autoclaves

文献ID: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_015_chunk2
证据片段: the autoclave was charged with hydrogen to a pressure of $1 . 4 ~ \mathsf { M P a }$ (200 psi)

文献ID: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_015_chunk2
证据片段: Impedance measurements were made at room temperature and $1 \mathbf { k H z }$ in a 1-M ammonium nitrate solution

文献ID: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_015_chunk2
证据片段: Specimens were also corroded in molten LiNO,(95)-LiOH(5) and NaOH(82)-LiOH(18 at $5 8 9 ~ \mathrm { \bf K }$

文献ID: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_015_chunk2
证据片段: Specimens were also corroded in molten LiNO,(95)-LiOH(5) and NaOH(82)-LiOH(18 at $5 8 9 ~ \mathrm { \bf K }$

文献ID: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_015_chunk3
证据片段: Specimens corroded in the concentrated solutions to weight gains of 30, 60, and 90 mg·dm⁻²

文献ID: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_015_chunk3
证据片段: The oxide crystallites protruding out in relief and giving rise to this type of texture are about 250 nm in size

文献ID: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_015_chunk3
证据片段: A level of 250 ppm was found by atomic absorption spectroscopy

证据片段: At 589 K, accelerated corrosion of Zircaloy-4 is observed in 0.5 and 1 M lithium hydroxide solutions in the time period of 8 days

文献ID: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_015_chunk5
证据片段: Hillner and Chirigos' data indicate an acceleration factor of 94 at 633 K for 4500 ppm of lithium in the oxide

文献ID: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_015_chunk5
证据片段: McDonald et al. found an accelerative factor of 347 for 576 ppm of lithium at the same temperature

文献ID: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_015_chunk5
证据片段: the amount of lithium in the oxide had increased steadily by nearly three times

文献ID: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_015_chunk5
证据片段: the dissociation of LiOH decreases with increasing temperature

文献ID: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_015_chunk5
证据片段: it decreases from 0.95 to 0.45 with increase in concentration of LiOH from 10^-4 to 10 M

文献ID: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_015_chunk5
证据片段: it decreases from 0.95 to 0.45 with increase in concentration of LiOH from 10^-4 to 10 M

文献ID: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_015_chunk6
证据片段: At $5 8 9 ~ \mathrm { \tt K }$ , Zircaloy-4 undergoes accelerated corrosion, from the very beginning, in 0.5 and $1 \textbf { M }$ solutions but not in dilute $1 0 ^ { - 3 }$ and $1 0 ^ { - 1 } \mathbf { M }$ solutions or in molten salts containing a higher concentration of lithium hydroxide than the concentrated aqueous solutions.

文献ID: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_015_chunk6
证据片段: At $5 8 9 ~ \mathrm { \tt K }$ , Zircaloy-4 undergoes accelerated corrosion, from the very beginning, in 0.5 and $1 \textbf { M }$ solutions but not in dilute $1 0 ^ { - 3 }$ and $1 0 ^ { - 1 } \mathbf { M }$ solutions or in molten salts containing a higher concentration of lithium hydroxide than the concentrated aqueous solutions.

文献ID: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_015_chunk6
证据片段: At $5 8 9 ~ \mathrm { \tt K }$ , Zircaloy-4 undergoes accelerated corrosion, from the very beginning, in 0.5 and $1 \textbf { M }$ solutions but not in dilute $1 0 ^ { - 3 }$ and $1 0 ^ { - 1 } \mathbf { M }$ solutions or in molten salts containing a higher concentration of lithium hydroxide than the concentrated aqueous solutions.

文献ID: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_015_chunk6
证据片段: At $5 8 9 ~ \mathrm { \tt K }$ , Zircaloy-4 undergoes accelerated corrosion, from the very beginning, in 0.5 and $1 \textbf { M }$ solutions but not in dilute $1 0 ^ { - 3 }$ and $1 0 ^ { - 1 } \mathbf { M }$ solutions or in molten salts containing a higher concentration of lithium hydroxide than the concentrated aqueous solutions.

文献ID: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_015_chunk6
证据片段: Impedance and polarization measurements indicate a high degree of porosity for the oxides formed in the concentrated solutions.

文献ID: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_015_chunk6
证据片段: X-ray diffraction, atomic absorption, Auger and secondary ion mass spectrometric analyses, indicate the presence of small quantities of lithium in the oxide.

文献ID: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_015_chunk6
证据片段: A major part of the lithium in the corrosion films is soluble and can be leached out in acid.
